item.title: DWS: German Defense Firms Need a Lot of Private Credit
item.description: With governments across the globe promising to increase their defense spending, more investment in defense firms is needed to meet this demand. This is a gap which private credit can fill says Stefan Hoops, CEO of asset management firm DWS. He sees the best private credit opportunities in non-publicly traded small and medium sized companies across the defense supply chain. Hoops spoke to Anna Edwards on 'Bloomberg: The Pulse'. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: What's Next After 'Remarkable' Market Bounce?
item.description: US equities are poised for gains as traders await June's payrolls report on Thursday and navigate how trade talks develop ahead of President Donald Trump's July 9 deadline. That's after Wall Street's bulls drove stocks to all-time highs at the end of a solid quarter amid hopes the US is moving closer to reaching concrete deals with its top trading partners. Erik Wytenus, EMEA Head of Investment Strategy for JP Morgan Private Bank joins Caroline Hepker and Tom Mackenzie on Bloomberg Radio to discuss the outlook for the market in the months ahead. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Expect One More ECB Cut by End of Year, BNP Paribas Says
item.description: BNP Paribas Chief Economist Isabelle Mateos y Lago discusses the exchange rate of the euro. "If we were to see much larger moves from here, at some point it would become a problem," she tells Bloomberg Television. "But I don't think we're in that zone yet." Mateos y Lago also talks about the European Central Bank's rate-cutting cycle and says she expects one more cut by the end of the year. "I think one cut makes sense, but the timing of that we have to see." (Source: Bloomberg)
